alert.note: Alert for Cabarrus; Union (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 22 at 10:28PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following counties, Cabarrus and Union. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1022 PM EDT, The chances for additional heavy showers within the advised area is low, but after a 2.5 to 3.5 inch rainfall this evening, lingering high water conditions and low spot flooding will only slowly recede over the next several hours. Remain wary these high water conditions from Midland to Fairview tonight and watch for rises along select tributaries of the Rocky River. This advisory will expire on schedule. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mint Hill, Indian Trail, Stallings, Unionville, Hemby Bridge, Fairview In Union County and Midland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
